questions.question_text:
Paragraph

When 100 mL of 1.0 M KCl was mixed with 100 mL of 1.0 M NaOH in an insulated beaker at constant pressure, a temperature increase of 5.7o C was measured for the beaker and its contents (Expt. 1). Because the enthalpy of neutralization of a strong acid with a strong base is constant (-57.0 kJ/mol), this experiment could be used to measure the calorimeter constant. In a second experiment (Expt. 2) 100 mL of 2.0 M acetic acid (Ka = 2.0 $$\times$$ 10-5) was mixed with 100 mL of 1.0 M NaOH (under identical conditions to Expt. 1) where a temperature rise of 5.6o C was measured. (Consider heat capacity of all solutions as 4.2 J/gK and density of all solutions as 1.0 g m/L)

Question

The pH of the solution after Expt. 2 is
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:
Paragraph
When 100 mL of 1.0 M KCl was mixed with 100 mL of 1.0 M NaOH in an insulated beaker at constant pressure, a temperature increase of 5.7^{o} C was measured for the beaker and its contents (Expt. 1). Because the enthalpy of neutralization of a strong acid with a strong base is constant (-57.0 kJ/mol), this experiment could be used to measure the calorimeter constant. In a second experiment (Expt. 2) 100 mL of 2.0 M acetic acid (K_{a} = 2.0 $$\times$$ 10^{-5}) was mixed with 100 mL of 1.0 M NaOH (under identical conditions to Expt. 1) where a temperature rise of 5.6^{o} C was measured. (Consider heat capacity of all solutions as 4.2 J/gK and density of all solutions as 1.0 g m/L)
Question
The pH of the solution after Expt. 2 is

In a second experiment (Expt. 2) 100 mL of 2.0 M acetic acid (Ka = 2.0 $$\times$$ 10-5) was mixed with 100 mL of 1.0 M NaOH (under identical conditions to Expt. 1) where a temperature rise of 5.6o C was measured. (Consider heat capacity of all solutions as 4.2 J/gK and density of all solutions as 1.0 g m/L)

questions.question_text: Consider a uniform spherical charge distribution of radius $${R_1}$$ centred at the origin $$O.$$ In this distribution, a spherical cavity of radius $${R_2},$$ centred at $$P$$ with distance $$OP=a$$ $$ = {R_1} - {R_2}$$ (see figure) is made. If the electric field inside the cavity at position $$\overrightarrow r $$ is $$\overrightarrow E \overrightarrow {\left( r \right)} ,$$ then the correct statement(s) is (are)
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: $$\overrightarrow E $$ is uniform, its magnitude is independent of $${R_2}$$ but its direction depends on $$\overrightarrow r .$$
options.B: $$\overrightarrow E $$ is uniform, its magnitude depends on $${R_2}$$ and its direction depends on $$\overrightarrow r .$$
options.C: $$\overrightarrow E $$ is uniform, its magnitude is independent of a but its direction depends on $$\overrightarrow a $$
options.D: $$\overrightarrow E $$ is uniform and both its magnitude and direction depend on $$\overrightarrow a $$

questions.question_text:
An ideal monoatomic gas is confined in a horizontal cylinder by a spring loaded piston (as shown in the figure). Initially the gas is at temperature T1, pressure P1 and volume V1 and the spring is in its relaxed state. The gas is then heated very slowly to temperature T2, pressure P2 and volume V2. During this process the piston moves out by a distance x.

Ignoring the friction between the piston and the cylinder, the correct statements is/are
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: If V_{2} = 2V_{1} and T_{2} = 3T_{l}, then the energy stored in the spring is $${1 \over 4}{P_1}{V_1}$$
options.B: If V_{2} = 2V_{1} and T_{2} = 3T_{1}, then the change in internal energy is $$3{P_1}{V_1}$$
options.C: If V_{2}  = 3V_{1} and T_{2} = 4T_{1}, then the work done by the gas is $${7 \over 3}{P_1}{V_1}$$
options.D: If V_{2} = 3V_{1} and T_{2} = 4T_{1}, then the heat supplied to the gas is $${17 \over 6}{P_1}{V_1}$$

questions.question_text:
A fission reaction is given by $$_{92}^{236}U \to _{54}^{140}Xe + _{38}^{94}Sr + x + y$$, where x and y are two particles. Considering $$_{92}^{236}U$$ to be at rest, the kinetic energies of the products are denoted by $${K_{Xe}},{K_{Sr}},{K_x}(2MeV)$$ $$
\text { and } \mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{y}}(2 \mathrm{MeV})
$$, respectively. Let the binding energies per nucleon of $$_{92}^{236}U$$, $$_{54}^{140}Xe$$ and $$_{38}^{94}Sr$$ be 7.5 MeV, 8.5 MeV and 8.5 MeV, respectively. Considering different conservation laws, the correct options is/are
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: x = n, y = n, K_{sr} = 129 MeV, K_{Xe} = 86 MeV
options.C: x = p, y = n, K_{sr} = 129 MeV, K_{Xe} = 86 MeV
options.D: x = n, y = n, K_{sr} = 86 MeV, K_{Xe} = 129 MeV
